body:
Currently, invoking Python's builtin unary operators on columns raises:

```python
>>> s = cudf.Series([1, 2, 3])
>>> -s._column  # TypeError
```

This came up in https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/pull/10564.

A workaround is to do for example, `s._column.unary_operator("abs")` or `0 - s._column`, but it would be nice to do this in a more Pythonic way.

comments.body: Similar to how I've defined a mixin for binary operations, I plan to do the same for unary operations. At that point I also plan to apply that to columns so that we can define suitable operators there.
